In India there is an enormous gap between healthcare supply and demand. What do you think are the major steps that can be taken by the government to improve patient care in the country?

Now a days in India  as we can see a drastic change in the field of medical .As in older days we may not have that well equipped medical facilities. In older days, the people were not aware of healthcare .This is the reason why in India the death rate and birth has been increased,
but trends and environment are drastically changing, we even can see  their is an impact on people behaviour.As income might is the main cause which may have an impact on every family. This could be the reason why most of the people may not go expensive treatments.

                 Education also played an vital role in increasing awareness about the health. As most of the institute as Health Care Management System as part of academics. We even can see an enormous improvement as in present scenario we have treatment for cancer which was non curable disease at times, but now we can see we even have treatment for all the disease. Television and advertising media also played an vital role as we can they are  playing an major role in increasing health awareness.Advertising in one of the major tool  which focused on niche market segment to in increase awareness about health.

                Major steps which could taken by the government in order to improve health care  are :They should first focus on increasing the awareness among people including niche market segment. Government can also increase awareness by conducting medical camps in rural areas. They must also focus on increasing medical facilities such as well equipped technology machines, cleanliness in government hospital, hiring trained doctors and proper guidance. They can even provide  one day free for check-ups such as eye check-ups ,blood pressure,mris. Making it mandatory in all  schools including government schools ,colleges as an mandatory subject which would help to increase the awareness among people.  In each of the private hospitals government must make rule that every they must provide to at least 20 of the patients free treatments which mainly focuses on middle class and lower class families.
